page.title: 07Activities at Budds Farm
page.content: {Budds Farm}has 200 acres of land. On the farm are 102 Fresian Cows in the milking herd. They are milked twice a day, at 6am and 3.30pm, 7 days a week. Each milking takes the farmer about 1 hour and 15 minutes. The farm also has 50 Beef cows and a bull, all white faced Herefords. There are also 100 followers on the farm, that is cows at other stages but not in these 2 herds. In the winter the cows come into a shed with 100 cubicles in it and stay there from October to March. There are no dogs, pigs,or sheep on the farm, but three pet cats and four pet ducks. There is a horse on the farm which is used for pleasure ridings. Moles are a problem on the farm, digging up the grass. There are a few hens on the farm, but the farmer's wife buys her eggs elsewhere. Varying types of bird, including Woodpeckers have been seen
